intro: Hieracium rapinii, commonly known as the Alpine Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, sunny environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disc. Hieracium rapinii is often found in high-altitude habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
